fields.description:
When editing a page and attaching multiple images with the same filename, the editor shows that each unique image will be saved and correctly displayed. Once the page is saved, or Preview is selected, only the last image shows multiple times.

Steps to reproduce:

This occurs in programs like Skitch, where you can easily drag and drop duplicate filenames into Confluence. If you drag from Skitch to the Mac OS (say, on your desktop), the OS will rename the file and will not exhibit this behavior since the filename is unique. This only occurs with duplicate filenames.

1. Create images with duplicate names:

2. Drag and Drop directly into a Confluence page which is being edited.

3. Observe that, even though the filenames are the same, the page shows that the unique images will be displayed:
!Same Filename 1.png|thumbnail! !Same Filename 2.png|thumbnail! !Same Filename 3.png|thumbnail!

4. Click on either Preview or Save, and observe that only the last image is displayed multiple times.
!Preview Screen.png|thumbnail!!Saved.png|thumbnail!


The workaround for this issue is to make sure that all image filenames are unique, but the purpose of this bug is to report that the UI should not show unique images (when, in reality, they will be duplicated when saved).
fields.summary: Uploading multiple images with duplicate filename shows incorrectly during editing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37091].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Write some source code under code block macro on a Confluence page.
# Make sure you "tab" on every new line.
# Save the page
# Double click to select, the copy then text.
# Paste it on a text editor and tabs will be replaced for spaces. 
# Copy *one* of the spaces to the clipboard
# Go to http://repl.it/languages/PHP
# Type: {code} ord('[paste]'); {code}
where [paste] is Ctrl-V, pasting from the clipboard.
# The result you get is 194
# Now just type: {code} ord(' '); {code}
with a normal spacebar space.  The result you get is 32.
fields.summary: Codeblock macro converts tab to 4x ASCII 194 characters.

fields.description:
The following is an error example. It happened when I tried to create a new user or resetting password for existing user who cannot login to Confluence.

Note: some users actually can login properly and use without any issue. But many users cannot login. However, for an user who had an already logged in session(and username/password is remembered), he/she can work with Confluence properly, but they cannot login through a browser which doesn't have logged in session.

It asked me to check the log, however I couldn't find anything in /opt/atlassian/confluence/logs/catalina.out

Environment:
A server installed JIRA(IP: 1.1.1.111, using port 8080) and Confluence(IP: 1.1.1.113, using port 8090). JIRA is working fine.
I also have a proxy which directs all the traffic of http://1.1.1.111/ to http://1.1.1.111:8080/ (JIRA) and http://1.1.1.113 to http://1.1.1.113:8090 (Confluence).

fields.summary: Cannot create user in Confluence, some users can login while some can't

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37088].
  {panel}

We manage all of our permissions in Active Directory via permissions groups that follow a strict naming convention to specify space permissions.  For example:
- TOOL_Confluence_Main_Admin: This group has Admin permissions in the "Main" space.
- TOOL_Confluence_Main_Edit: This group has edit permissions in the "Main" space
- TOOL_Confluence_Main_Comment: This group has comment permissions in the "Main" space
- TOOL_Confluence_Main_View: This group has view-only permissions in the "Main" space

The idea is that all permissions are managed in Active Directory, and it is very easy to see exactly who has permissions in which Confluence spaces, and what level of permissions they have - both inside AD and inside Confluence.

We have trained all the Confluence System Administrators to set permissions up this way when a new space is created - and only system admins are allowed to create site level spaces.  The problem is, there is no reasonable way to restrict the management of permissions to ONLY Confluence System Administrators.  

We could make it so that ONLY Confluence System Administrators have "Admin" permissions in all spaces.  The problem with this option is that teams and departments then have no way of doing the other space administration tasks that we would like to allow them to do such as customizing their sidebars.

Security is the other important factor here.  It is important that only trained administrators manage permissions because untrained users may grant permissions to groups that are too broad and include external contractors that should only have limited access to spaces on an as-needed basis.

My request is as follows:
(1) Add a "Permissions" checkbox on the space permissions page - or modify the exiting "restrictions" checkbox to also apply to permissions.
(2) Make it so that if "Permissions" or "Restrictions" is unchecked then the user cannot manage permissions or restrictions - even if the "Admin" box is checked.  Currently, with the Admin box checked, a Space Administrator can manage restrictions, even if the "Restrictions" box is not checked.
fields.summary: Separate permissions management from space administration

fields.summary: Address Book Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37081].
  {panel}

When a page properties macro includes an @mention or date macro, then this will be included in the page properties report.  However, if the @mention or date macro is then followed or preceded by an & symbol, the page properties report does not display these as expected.

!mention-should-display.png|thumbnail!

Instead, there is a displayed error:

{noformat}
Error: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 869. Parser message: Unexpected character ' ' (code 32) (missing name?) at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,869]
{noformat}

...and 480 lines of exception logging  (see attached) that starts:

{noformat}
2015-03-30 11:29:00,482 ERROR [http-bio-8090-exec-122] [content.render.xhtml.DefaultRenderer] render Error rendering content for view: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 868. Parser message: Unexpected character ' ' (code 32) (missing name?)
 at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,868]
 -- referer: http://confluence.foo.bar.com/dashboard.action | url: /display/XXX/Report+Page | userName: userx | action: viewpage | page: 19993228
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlParsingException: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 868. Parser message: Unexpected character ' ' (code 32) (missing name?)
 at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,868]
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.StaxUtils.convertToXhtmlException(StaxUtils.java:473)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.storage.StorageXhtmlTransformer.transform(StorageXhtmlTransformer.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.TransformerChain.transform(TransformerChain.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.PluggableTransformerChain.transform(PluggableTransformerChain.java:51)
{noformat}

h4.To Replicate
# Create a page using page properties macro with label test-mention
# Within the page properties macro, have a field "user" with content that is an @mention for "userx" (or a date macro), followed by text "& team"
# Create a page using page properties report macro
# Edit the page properties report macro to use label "test-mention" and display the field "user"
# The resulting report displays column "user" with error "Error: The XML content could not be parsed."

h4.Expected behaviour
Instead of the error, expect:  "@userx & team" or date macro & team

h5.Note
Not sure if this is a problem with Confluence base rendering, with @mentions, or is specific to the macros tested.
fields.summary: Page Property Report Displays "Error: The XML content could not be parsed" for & character following an @mention or // date macro

fields.description:
We use the NetWorkDays function often to know how many work days do we have in real.
But when we would like to show the Excel file with the Office Connector it shows the wrong day count, if we do not include the weekends. 
And this won't work always, too.
If you open the Excel file with MS Excel the counts are right.

Find attached the example Excel file and a screenshot of our test in Confluence.
You can work with the Excel file in your test system.

We gave the prio "Major", because we use this function often in our Excel files.
fields.summary: Office Excel Macro doesn't work correctly with NetWorkDays function

fields.description:
When selecting a table row and applying cell colour, the colour is not saved.

*Steps to replicate* (see video - [^TableRowColor.mp4])
# Create a page
# Insert a table 4x4
# Fill the table with some words
# Highlight 1 row
# Apply Cell Colour and *Save the page immediately* without moving the cursor

*Observation*
This is tested on Google Chrome version 41. If the cursor is moved right after the colour is applied, the formatting will work successfully after the page is saved.
fields.summary: Colour Not Applied to Table Row After Saved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37076].
  {panel}

In Confluence 5.7 the table _attachments_ was removed and attachments are now referenced in the _content_ table.

The documentation page [Hierarchical File System Attachment Storage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Hierarchical+File+System+Attachment+Storage] still mentions _attachmentid_ and _contentid_ (for the page) when it should differentiate between:
* _contentid_ of the page.
* _contentid_ of the attachment.
fields.summary: Hierarchical File System Attachment Storage needs to be updated to reflect changes in the database

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Follow the workaround in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36389
# Add an Application Link to another product (eg: JIRA, Stash)
# Go to *Confluence Admin > Application Navigator* and hit the refresh icon in the top right

This will cause the link automatically generated in step 2 to disappear. The Application Navigator itself will now only display the link to Confluence and any custom (non automatically generated) links. After a consistent time period (roughly 10 seconds), the instance will recover the missing links.
fields.summary: The Application Navigator loses its Application Link generated applications upon refresh

fields.description: At the moment, the bundled JAVA is version 1.7.0_15. The recent JAVA version is 1.7.72, which has many security patches (http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpuoct2014-1972960.html). Does the security vulnerabilities on bundled JAVA JRE something that we should be concerned about?
fields.summary: Bundled Java Version Security Patches

fields.description:
When pasting content inside page layouts2 the table gets stripped out, when pasting the same contens with the same clipboard outside it, it seems to work just fine

{quote}I am trying to copy this table into this page:

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/PUR/Gold+Rush+Weekly+Status+20150327

However, when pasting this table in the page, it looses the table cells itself and copies it as free form text.

The same process used to work and is still working in Chrome{quote}
fields.summary: Copying and pasting tables inside pagelayouts 2 in firefox sometimes copy only content
Mail Queue is not sending mail

I can't seem to edit bars in the Roadmap Planner Macro.
Nothing happens when I click on the bars, however, they can still be moved around.
fields.summary: Can't edit bars in Roadmap Planner Macro

fields.description:
Automatic user synchronization (when a synchronization interval is set) stops working when manual synchronization is run.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a User Directory in Confluence (e.g. with a JIRA server or AD)
# Define a Synchronisation Interval (e.g. 5 minutes)
# Check it is running fine.
# Click *Synchronize* on the directory listing.
# Wait for the Synchronisation Interval again. It won't run.

*Workaround*

To have it working again, it is necessary to Edit the User Directory and set the Synchronisation Interval again.

(Copied from STASH-6828. Tested 5.7.1, but the bug probably exists far back.)
fields.summary: Automatic user synchronization stops if manual synchronization is performed

fields.description:
After a recent upgrade from 5.2 to 5.7.1 the preview capability seems to fail for text/plain files.

I am seeing the following output in the log file when a user attempts to preview an attachment 

{{ERROR [conversion-thread-198-internal] [conversion.impl.runnable.ConversionRunnable] doWork Format cannot be converted}}

So far this only seems to affect text/plain files on our system; i am guess it's related to CONF-36666. However when i examine the contents of the CONTENTPROPERTIES table nothing looks incorrect.
fields.summary: Unable to preview text files after 5.7.1 upgrade

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

#  Add a new space
# Add a any attachment into the space (exp: gliffy )
# Archive the space
#  Search Attachment in Archived Space
# Click on the attachment


*Expected Result*
It will redirect to the page just like searching attachment from *none archived space* 
!search.PNG|thumbnail!


*preview*
!preview.PNG|thumbnail!
Preview

*End result:*
For xls or doc file, it will download the attachment

For gliffy attachment, it will redirect to the attachment instead: 
!gliffy.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attachment Search in Archive space lead to download

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37057].
  {panel}

h3. How To Reproduce
# Login as administrator on both Confluence and JIRA.
# Enable anonymous access with *Can Use* permissions via *Confluence Administration Console* > *Global Permissions*.
# Create a new *Public Space*.
# Enable anonymous access with *View* permissions on the created space via *Space tools* > *Permissions* > *Anonymous Access*.
# Create a new *Project* in JIRA.
# Create a new *Permission Schemes* and add all permissions to *Group (Anyone)*.
# Create a new *Issue Security Schemes* and add a security level with *Group (Anyone)* permission.
# Make this security level as the default security level for the new *Project*.
# Apply both *Permission Schemes* and *Issue Security Schemes* to the new *Project*.
# Create a new issue in the new *Project*.
# Copy the new *JIRA Issue* link to a Confluence page.
# Logout Confluence as anonymous user.
# Access and observe the page with JIRA link.

h3. Expected Behaviour
Anonymous should be able to view the contents within the public Confluence page.
!conf-exp.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Behaviour
JIRA Issue link is broken in Confluence page.
!conf-actual.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Remove the *Security Level* temporarily from the *JIRA Issue*.
fields.summary: JIRA Links Cannot Be Displayed When Issue Security Level Is Applied

fields.description:
We have found that the caching mechanism in Confluence 5.4.1 may be flawed (or any version of Confluence that comes with embedded Crowd 2.7.0) , in a way that users may randomly lose their group memberships once they login. 

This is true even if the LDIF looks perfect, example:
# Group confluence-users:
{code}
dn: cn=confluence-users,ou=Groups,dc=example,dc=com
objectClass: posixGroup
objectClass: top
cn: confluence-users
memberUid: uid=foo,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com
{code}
# User foo:
{code}
dn: uid=foo,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com
objectClass: posixAccount
objectClass: top
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
gidNumber: 65534
uid: foo
givenName: foo
sn: foo
displayName: foo
mail:foo@foo.foo
cn: foo
uidNumber: 64702
userPassword: pass
{code}
# Directory Configuration Summary:
{code}
    "ldap.basedn": "dc=example,dc=com"
    "ldap.group.dn": "ou=Groups"
    "ldap.group.filter": "(objectclass=posixGroup)"
    "ldap.group.name": "cn"
    "ldap.group.objectclass": "posixGroup"
    "ldap.group.usernames": "memberUid"
    "ldap.user.displayname": "displayName"
    "ldap.user.dn": "ou=Users"
    "ldap.user.email": "mail"
    "ldap.user.filter": "(objectclass=posixAccount)"
    "ldap.user.firstname": "givenName"
    "ldap.user.lastname": "sn"
    "ldap.user.objectclass": "posixAccount"
    "ldap.user.password": "userPassword"
    "ldap.user.username": "uid"
    "ldap.user.username.rdn": "uid"
    "ldap.usermembership.use": "false"
    "ldap.usermembership.use.for.groups": "false"
{code}

In the example above, foo will be the member of confluence-users *after synchronization*, but once foo logs into Confluence, he will no longer be a member of the said group. 

*The group only exists once in the entire LDAP directory, and so is the user*

*There are no synchronization errors in the logs whatsoever*. The issue persists despite creating another directory with the same exact configuration in {{Confluence Administration >> User Directories}}, despite flushing all the caches, and a Confluence restart. 

*This issue is resolved by upgrading to Confluence 5.5 or greater*, which uses a newer version of embedded Crowd
fields.summary: User Loses Membership Upon Login

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37052].
  {panel}

Currently Confluence notification workbox only show you the following notifications from JIRA:
* Comments on issues that you are watching.
* Mentions.
* Shares of issues, filters and searches.
 
Since JIRA have several [notification schemas|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Notification+Scheme] it would be good that the Confluence workbox would also notify on those, like when a issue get assigned to your user in JIRA, for instance.
fields.summary: JIRA notifications schemes should show up on Confluence worbox

fields.description:
Issue:
From Confluence using the Insert JIRA Issue macro I can create a new standard issue fine (e.g. story, feature, bug) but when i try to create a new sub task i get an error.  

Hypothesis:
What i think is going on here is i am trying to create a sub task but a sub task requires a parent and in the create JIRA issue screen there is no way to define the parent of the sub task. My guess is the JIRA Issue macro only allows you to directly create standard issue types (e.g. story, bug, feature, etc..) but not sub issues (e.g. sub task, dev sub task, quality sub task, etc..) and the confusing part is the UI shows sub tasks when it shouldn't, it should only show issue types that will work (short coming of the UI). 

Atlassian Answers Question: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/14194497/insert-jira-issue-macro-create-sub-issue-throws-error
fields.summary: Confluence: Insert jira issue macro create sub issue throws error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37046].
  {panel}

Viewing attachments is inconsistent and quite a pain.  As I work a lot with images, I would like to very quickly see and update many images simultaneously.

There are three ways to see the attachments on a page/space, each containing different options and only one of which allows you to see the attachments.  

I've attached three images to show the options for viewing attachments:

1/ The first is the typical way of viewing all attachments on a page by clicking on the drop-down menu on the top-right corner of a page. 
2/ By adding the Attachments macro to a page. Here you CAN view the image. This is what I would like.
3/ By going to the Space Tools > Attachments. This shows almost the same as 1/ however does not allow you to edit the image on the page.

If find this very confusing.{color:red}* Why are there three different ways of listing the attachments?*{color}

The feature I really would like most is the ability to view the actual image in all three cases (as per option 2/).  The second option would be to quickly update in mass the metadata associated with the images (IE labels, names etc). 

I have contacted support and was told it could be too difficult.  However if it viewing images already possible in one of the three options noted above, why can it not be applied for all?  Why can't we choose the meta-data we want to see associated with the attachments?  Perhaps not all attachement types need to be visible - say only JPGs and other simple image types.   

Many thanks!!
fields.summary: Confluence attachments view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37044].
  {panel}

The gallery is a great feature for Confluence - to bring life to many pages. 
However, usually the images I want to share are spread over a tree of pages or an entire space.  As these spaces are constantly growing with new content, it is impossible to maintain the list of pages individually in the gallery settings.

Can we specify a SPACEKEY by itself (without page title)?  

Or, can we have a checkbox to indicate all pages below the specified pages in subtrees?

Thank you
fields.summary: Allow gallery to display all pages in a page tree and/or space

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 29 July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
After some analysis we've found that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at CONFSERVER-34149 - JIRA Issue Macro not showing value for Σ Remaining Estimate. This is a current and verified bug in Confluence, please watch that issue for further updates.
{panel}
Σ Remaining Estimate does not return any value despite having values in *Σ Original Estimate* and *Σ Time Spent* columns.
h3. How to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue or task in JIRA. (let's say ABC)
 # Create a couple of sub-tasks under the ABC task.
 (i) Log some time into the tasks respectively for best results.
 # Connect Confluence and JIRA via *Application Links* configuration panel.
 # Create a new page in Confluence.
 # Insert *JIRA Issues* macro via "*+*" sign in the editor toolbar.
 # Under *Search* tab, insert the related ABC tasks (which includes the sub-tasks) or use a JQL. For example:
{code:java}
project = "ABC"{code}

 # Use the following display options. (Key, Summary, Issue Type, Due Date, Assignee, Priority, Status, Σ Original Estimate, Σ Time Spent, Σ Remaining Estimate, Original Estimate, Time Spent, Remaining Estimate)
 !display.png|thumbnail!
 # Click *Insert* to confirm and add the JIRA Issues macro to the page.
 # Observe the value in the *Σ Remaining Estimate* column.

h3. Expected Behaviour

All values are shown in the columns.
h3. Actual Behaviour

*Σ Remaining Estimate* value is missing.
 !conf-jira.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Σ Remaining Estimate Does Not Show Any Values in JIRA Issues Macro

fields.description:
Some Attachment (non-office file, non-txt) that's uploaded by dragging and dropping to the page will have content/MIME type {{application/x-upload-data}}

*Steps to replicate*
# View a Confluence page
# Upload an non-office and non-txt attachment to the page by drag and dropping the file to the page
# Go to {{Tools >> Attachment}}
# Click on the Properties of the newly uploaded attachment

*Observation*
|| File Format || Content type (drag/drop) || Content type (browse and attach) ||
| .oft | application/x-upload-data | application/octet-stream |
| .xml | text/xml | text/xml |
| .ttf | application/x-upload-data | application/octet-stream |
| .jar | application/java-archive | application/java-archive |
| .ini | application/x-upload-data | application/octet-stream |

*Implication*
If the affected Attachment is embedded in Confluence page (attachment link), it might not be able to be downloaded using IE when the security/firewall doesn't allow MIME type {{application/x-upload-data}}
fields.summary: Drag and Drop Cause Some Attachment Content Type Stored As application/x-upload-data

In Confluence, we have the option to select either a text or something in the page and click on *insert link* in order to link a text for an attachment, for example. If you do the same with the [Status macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Status+Macro], the macro will simply disappear. 

Steps to reproduce:

# Insert a status macro on the page (Insert > Status)
# !statustest.png!
# Select the status label inserted on the page and click on Link
!statuslink.png!
# Select the *Attachments* option for the link
!statusattachment.png!
# Save the changes and the macro will disappear.
!statusresult.png!
fields.summary: Status Macro Vanishes if Adding Link to Attachments

fields.description: When copying a page to a new page that includes the Attachments macro, it will pull in the attachments for the old page, not the new page.  This remains the case even when you add a new Attachments macro to the page - it's still associated with the original page from which the page was copied from. It is impossible to then only show new attachments for that single page.
fields.summary: When copying page, Attachments macro is associated with old page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37016].
  {panel}

*Request Background*

Confluence super-users have the ability to see all restricted pages if they have the complete URL to the said pages. However during the space export process, super-users unable to see those restricted pages in the list of pages when choosing "Custom Export".

This may cause super-users to miss some restricted pages if they are requested to create a space export with only specific contents (unable to use the complete space export option) and include the restricted page.

*Workaround*

* Remove the restriction before creating the space export.
* Use the complete export and import it. Then remove all the unnecessary pages.
fields.summary: List Restricted Pages in "Custom Export" Option for Confluence Super-users

In order to manage the resolution of inline comments that may be spread over dozens of pages (and across multiple spaces), it would be useful to have an "Inline Comment Report" macro...  similar to the existing "Task Report" macro.

Thus, the report macro would allow filtering by:

* Space(s) and page(s)
* Labels
* Comment status (resolved, unresolved)
* Differentiate between comments on page and comments within attachments?
* etc

The "popular" tab on the Confluence Dashboard does list the number of comments... but this functionality does not provide the necessary filtering, etc.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37012].
  {panel}

Hi,
I'm using the "Recently updated" macro for our knowledge base and I'd like an option in this macro to display the latest comment added when saving the page. Currently we can only see update time, editor and we have a "view change" option that is good for document writers, not that good for customers who just want to know quickly what has been changed.
The "Activity Stream" macro allows us to see the comments added when saving but unfortunately does not allow us to add filters per label as the "Recently Updated" macro does.

Thanks
Bruno

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37005].
  {panel}

This bug is similar to this one, becouse colored panel macro swallow headings:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31089
As far as I can see it's fixed, but it reappeared in our stand-alone instance in version 5.7

Note that the bug only appears with colored panel macros!

Experienced behavior illustrated with images. When:
- you create a colored panel macro, put in one or more heading formatted lines after each other and you put an empty row after them (image_1)
- you create a colored panel macro, put in one or more heading formatted lines after each other and you put an unformatted ro after them (image_2)
- you create a colored panel macro, put in one ore more heading formatted lines and put unformatted row betweem them (image_3)

Hope I explanied correctly, in case of any questions please ask.

Thanks
fields.summary: Headings misbehave in colored panel macros

fields.description:
h5.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Word Document with a few headings and some content
# Enable Track Changes
# Make some changes to the document, but then do not accept them
# Import the word document into Confluence

h5. Expected Results
Most users would expect the document to be imported as it appears under "Final, without Markup".

h5. Actual Results
The document imports as if "Final with Markup" were displayed - changes since the last final verison of the document are imported as well.

h5. Notes
In one case that was observed, Confluence failed to import a word document when "Split by heading" was selected, and one of the headings had a length longer than 255 characters. While the 255 character limit on the database is fine in most titles, if there are two instances of the heading (caused by not accepting changes), it can easily go longer than the permissible title length, causing the import to fail.

h5.Workaround
Accept all changes in the Word Document before importing into Confluence
fields.summary: Importing a Word document with "Track Changes" enabled and unaccepted edits will cause old content to be imported along with new content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37001].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Space
# Create *Tasks* on any page in Confluence
# Create a page with the *Task Report Macro* and filter the report based on *Space* and *Page* to populate the Task.
# Export the Space to XML.
# Import the Space to New Confluence instance.

h4. Expected
Task report macro recognises tasks in the imported Space in the New Confluence instance.

h4. Actual
Task report displays message "Looking good, no incomplete tasks." in the imported Space in the New Confluence instance

h4. Workaround
The workaround discussed in [Certain tasks do not show up in the Task Report Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/certain-tasks-do-not-show-up-in-the-task-report-macro-658179671.html] works for when the macro uses the *Space Key* as the identifier, but not when the macro uses *Page ID*.

To populate the task reference the Page ID, edit the *Task Report Macro* from the imported Space and find the page where the task exist.
fields.summary: Task Report Macro is blank after importing space/site

fields.description:
Confluence rel. 5.7
Exporting a page with several pictures (heads of team members) doesn't show all jpgs.
The jpgs are all attached to that page and have all the same size 81x108 px.
PDF is displayed using Adobe Reader X 10.1.0. Preview in MS Office also shows that behavior.
Same behavior with Adobe Acrobat X rel. 10.1.13

fields.description:
Confluence Rel. 5.7
Embedding a PDF file of e.g. 8 pages using the macro "PDF" shows a - usually - grey frame (I don't mean the thumbnail) with a small centered icon. The first page of that document is not displayed. While in an older Confluence release one had to click once on the frame to get it displayed it is different with rel. 5.7. Turning pages sooner or later - looks kind of random - some pages are displayed, while others are not. E. g. from 8 pages the first 4 are not displayed i.e. you see a grey frame) and the last 4 are displayed. Deleting the embedded file and embedding it again could result in displaying different pages and others not. The behavior is reproducable - or I shall write: all former embedded files show this bug.
fields.summary: Embedding a PDF with PDF macro doesn't display all pages

fields.description:
h5. Issue:

When using Confluence with the {{Chart Macro}} and place a table or SQL macro inside. There is data missing in the chart to display when reviewing the chart on page.

h5. How to reproduce:
- Create a Chart Macro on a page.
- Place a 2 by X table into the macro.
- Place data fields inside.
- Save the page and review the results.
fields.summary: Chart Macro with Tables inside, missing data on chart display.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36985].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
When using the Roadmap Planner macro, if the name of the row is larger than the row itself (for example if the row has one bar but the name is "Requirements") the name will be shortened. See the following image:
!Roadmap macro.PNG|thumbnail!

The rows already scale in height based on the number of bars in the row.

h4. Solution
Either allow the row height to automatically scale to the length of the name, or allow users to be able to resize the height of the row manually.
fields.summary: Allow Roadmap Planner rows height to be resized

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce
# Edit the {{<confluence-install>/decorator/login/vmd}} file
# Add the the code below in the  <head> or <body> tag
{code}
	$helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{info}Test{info}
{code}

h3.Expected Result. 
The word test is rendered in a info macro

h3. Observed Result
The info macro border is missing 
!sample_1.png|thumbnail!

h3.Extra Notes
* Other macro (eg. panel, noformat) can be displayed with the border properly.
* The same code work in Confluence 5.6 display the info macro border even if put into the in <head> and <body> tag.
*  The same code renders properly when put in the <html> tag before/after  <head> and <body> tag. By putting the code in the <html> tag, the code in the <body> and <head> tag will also be rendered properly
{code}
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>$helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{info}test{info}")	
<head>
{code}
!sample_2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Info macro does not render properly when used in the  <HEAD> and <BODY> tag in  login.vmd file.

fields.description:
Each time I try to raise the level of logging to "Diagnostic", the appender is closing. Result is no more log until restart of confluence :-/

To reproduce:
Admin console -> Logging & Profiling -> Click on "Diagnostic"

The action throws a last line in "attlassian-confluence,log":
2015-03-23 14:15:27,160 DEBUG [http-bio-8090-exec-6] [atlassian.confluence.logging.ConfluenceHomeLogAppender] shutdown closing appender

No more entry in the log until restart of Confluence, which reset the loging level to "Production".

The issue occurs since several releases (I've listed the 3 ones we used in production).
fields.summary: Set logging level as "Diagnostic" closes log appender

fields.description:
When adding an Excel (xls & xlsx) as an embedded file, content in cell is not displayed properly. In the following steps, the first character is not displayed in the File Preview.

*Steps to replicate*
# Create a page
# Click on Files
# Upload and select this files ([^TestFF1.xlsx])
# Save the page
# Click the file to see the Preview (eg. Sample Result [^ExcelPreview.JPG])

*Observed behaviour*
The following combination of formatting caused this issue:
- Use font Verdana size 7.5
- Set the Column Width as 8
- 8 digits number is set with a custom format (### ## ###) - might be a phone number format
- The first digit is not displayed at the File Preview

*Workaround*
- Use different font
- Increase font size
- Increase the Column Width
fields.summary: Content Is Not Displayed Properly in Excel File Preview

fields.description:
Hi,
we are using the cofluence SOAP API for synchronizing content between different confluence instances. On production we use 5.4.1. We are now testing 5.7.1 and experience problems with 5.7.1: The method

bq. getDescendents(String token, String pageId)

from the SOAP API (see https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-rest-api/confluence-xml-rpc-and-soap-apis/remote-confluence-methods) used to return the page descendants. Now it returns an empty list.
I noticed that on the Java API there are now two similar methods (with a different typing) on the Page Object:

{quote}
getDescendents() [Deprecated]
getDescendants()
{quote}

see https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/Page.html

Could it be that this rename caused the problems in the SOAP API?

Best regards
Bernd
fields.summary: SOAP API: method getDescendents(String token, String pageId) does not work any more with Confluence 5.7.1
